text:
Ergkin Ataman at Sport24.gr: I am the man, Ataman
One of Europe's top coaches, Ergkin Ataman, speaks to Sport24.gr about Efes, the "eternal", the mythical offer he made to Spanoulis, Obradovic, Micic and his episode with the Greek. journalist. What about the new Euroleague and the NBA.
07 Nov 2019, 09:36 by Pantelis Vlachopoulos
Ergkin Ataman is one of the celebrities who have stolen the show in recent years at Euroleague. With Anadolu Efes last year he reached the F4 final and this year he wants to win the trophy. He is considered eccentric, likes good life and does not hesitate to share them with their players, with opposing coaches (Obradovic) and journalists. The 53-year-old coach answers all questions on Sport24.gr directly.

Coach, back to Athens again ...

"Yes. This year Euroleague has a different schedule and you can play two or three consecutive games at home. Now we have two consecutive games in Athens. Last week against Panathinaikos, now with Olympiacos. Always the games between Efes and two Greek teams are derby. We know that these teams need special attention and especially the Greek players. "

When I told my colleagues that I was interviewing Coach Ataman, they responded with admiration for your name. Do you feel this respect among sports fans and journalists in Greece?

"After so many years of visiting your country, walking around Athens, walking in Kolonaki, I am glad that people recognize me, greet me, ask me to take pictures. I like Greece, we look like people. I like people. and the atmosphere. I feel like I'm in Turkey. "

Interview with Pantelis Vlachopoulos






So is it somehow like your second home?

"Not exactly. My second home is Italy. I've lived there for about ten years. But I feel very comfortable in Greece. I may not speak your language, but I do understand something. I understand some words, but most of the words are difficult to understand. "Your language is the most difficult. I love your country nightlife, strolling the sea. Life in Greece looks great. Lots of cafes, lots of restaurants. Very nice life."

Let's go to basketball. Efes reached the final last year. More good players, better teams and more trips this year. Does all this give you extra motivation?

"Sure. Last year was fantastic. We played great basketball. This season is different. More games and people are expecting a lot from us because we got to the Final Four last year. We have the pressure, but we are a good team, we have new players. like Sigleton and Peters who help us out a lot. We have of course except Moorman who is very important to us and we expect him to come back in mid-December so that all the rosters are ready. "

So is your goal for this year's Final Four?

"Of course. Many may not believe us because there are now at least twelve very strong teams and I believe all twelve will be competitive in the majors. The situation that each team will face when they enter the octagon plays an important role. Expectations from our fans are to enter the top four again and why not, to win the trophy this year. Last year we played in the final, this year I would like to win it. "

What was the secret of last season? The chemistry, the budget, the coach?

"All this together. Last year we had a high budget, but we are not in the most expensive teams. But you know money doesn't play that big role. It is very important to find chemistry to have good players. I also find it very important that we created We have been trying for the last couple of years and I think it has now been established, remember that everyone was talking about Larkin, but if we go back we will see that for a long time since the start of the season we would have been playing without him. ezon like Dunst and Moerman. Together they made their best season of his career. Of course there were other very strong teams, but some details have made the difference. "
THE TRAVELS, OMBRANDOVITS AND THE NBA

How difficult is it to play so many games, with so many trips and at the same time remain competitive in the Turkish league?

"I think playing consecutive games is not that difficult. Neither is training the problem. The point is travel. So many trips, with the economy in place, to go to the airport two hours before check-in. At Euroleague we will play double matches in a month. We could play three games, as long as the conditions were similar to the NBA. Sometimes they play five games but they are more relaxed and comfortable on the move. i like to play more like players like to play than train, basketball is changing, people want more fun, it's more like a show, traveling makes life difficult for players, many athletes who had obligations with their national team and traveled to China were burdened and faced other problems such as injuries. "

What do you think is the solution?

"Look at Euroleague this year with eight to nine weeks of double play. The action starts in October and ends in April. More games, more commitments, National teams in the summer. Players need more time to rest. solution, to have time to rest in the middle of the year. Not just from Euroleague but from all the competitions. "




Zeljko Obradovic has a similar view. What is your relationship at this time?

"We have a great relationship. He is now the president of the Euroleague Coaches Association and we are discussing many issues on a number of occasions. For problems that coaches and teams can face. We exchange views on basketball, we are looking for ways to improve a lot. things. I think we can make basketball better. "

What do you think about Olympiakos' decision not to play in the Greek Championship?

"I would not like to comment on this matter. It is a radical change for Olympiacos. We who are outside need to respect that decision. A few years ago the two Greek teams had closed positions for the Final Four and now this Maybe it's the fact that they don't have big budgets or that some of the Greek players are starting to grow. On the other hand some new players are going to the NBA and Turkey is facing the same problem. What has not changed is the atmosphere in Greek stadiums ".

Would you work for a Greek team?

"I am a professional. I work to achieve goals. Motivation and goals can be found in many places like in Greece. At the moment, however, I am coaching one of the biggest clubs in Europe. I want to succeed with this team and feel it I am in this club for many years, I feel at home. I will be proud to become the most successful coach in Efes history. Of course as I said before I am a professional so why not in Greece and why not in the NBA? not to try Zeljko Obradovic f the NBA, why not Itoudis, why not Ataman. A Euroleague coach is at a very high level. Basketball is the same everywhere. After all, many NBA players come to Europe. "
This is how I am, so is Ataman

You're not angry today. You are very calm.

"I'm always calm."

I don't always think so. What happened at the press conference in OAKA with Panathinaikos?

"Yes at the press conference I made a comment about the game and some journalist tried to comment on my comment. The job of the reporter is to ask me a question. Not to comment on what I've said. That's the problem, and believe me This is the case with all coaches. It has happened at other times as with Mourinho in football. I respect all the journalists, but it is not right to comment on my comment. "

Has the affair with Missic ended?

"Of course. Misic is a young player and whatever I say inside and outside the pitch is for some reason."

Yes but your comment - unprofessional - was a bit harsh.

"Look. This is Ataman coach. Sometimes there are different reactions in a time out, on the pitch or in a training session. But all my players know that what I say is for their improvement. I've had my whole career. good relationship with all my players, in the end everyone knows what i'm saying is for their own good, sometimes i can speak publicly about their mistakes. I left them on the bench.
Diamantidis was great, he played great defense, but Spanoulis is the best in the last 10 years

Spanoulis or Diamantides. Who do you prefer?

"I prefer Spanoulis. I like this kind of players. I used to work with Stefanov, Arogy, I like that kind of point guard. But Spanoulis has been the best in the last ten years. He's been fantastic at pick and roll. Every year I've been trying to get Spanoulis in my teams. That's the truth.
In Galata in 2013, we had a huge offer for him. If I recall correctly it was close to 7.5 million for a three year contract. But he preferred to stay with Olympiacos. Every summer I ask if he has a problem with his team or with a coach. If he had remained free, Ataman would not have let him. For me Spanoulis is the toughest opponent. "




Could you describe in three words Coach Ataman?

"This is difficult. I certainly do not deal with politics. I am always clear. I try to think of things other than basketball. the Saporta Cup. With Besiktas we won the Turkish Championship, with Galatasaray the Eurocup. Many who see me on the pitch nervous think I am like this in my normal life. But things are not so. "

What is Ataman's biggest dream?

"I was close to achieving my dream of winning the Final Four. Maybe winning a Olympic medal with a national team. But first I aim for Euroleague."

Is it possible to take over National Turkey in the future? For the Greek bench, the name of Rick Pitino is heard.

"That's great. I think the great coaches should be coaching National teams in big competitions. What I like about the National Team is that communication is easier since everyone speaks the same language. I really like the Spanish culture. "There is a great respect for Rick Pitino. I worked with the Turkish National Team for three years and had a great time. I think Sarica does a great job."

Last question. How did you manage to lose so many pounds?

"The mentality is what counts. In the summer I gained a lot of pounds and my wife constantly criticized me and told me to take care of my health. One night in late August I was in Italy. I really like Italian food. That night. "I ate everything above the table. I couldn't sleep all night. That night, so I decided to restart and lose the extra pounds. I want to go on and lose maybe a few more pounds."



Editorial: Nikos Kyriakopoulos
Photo Credits: Andreas Papaconstantinou (Tourette Photography)
Thank you Athenaeum Palace Luxury Hotel for your hospitality
